page.title: 06HEALTH
page.content: We do not have a permanent surgery in our area but the local Doctor comes to Ingoldsby for surgery twice a week on Tuesday and Friday.The surgery takes place in the village hall at about 4o'clock.The Doctor brings a basket full of medicine so that you do not need to go to his main surgery. I think this is a good idea especially for OAPs and ill people.The Doctor calls in to see really ill people on Tuesday and Friday.If you are very ill and it is not Tuesday or Friday the Doctor will come over. Once a month on Wednesday there is a clinic for toddlers and babies.The clinic is run by two district nurses. At the clinic the two nurses weigh the babies and sell good food for the toddlers.If the baby is ill they will give the mother tablets or medicine, they also give injections.
